item.title: Trip hazard on road, 17th October
item.description:
There is loose paving at the top of Hadlow Road. When walking it is easy to trip and fall since the paving moves. Can this be fixed before someone hurts themselves please? The issue has been present for over a year but worried it will get worse the longer it isnâ€™t fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hadlow Road, Longlands, London

item.title: Dove house front door Cambridge road, 17th October
item.description:
Early this year a car crashed into the front access point and bin area of Dove house. The has not been repaired since and the bins are placed outside leaving a smell. No update when this will be repaired?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car park gate Cambridge road, 17th October
item.description:
Car park gate has been open which is hazard to health and safety. Recent fire incident caused during the time the gate was open due to open access. The fire was within the car park grounds which lead to the emergency staircase. This is a serious concern as lives were in danger and the gate is still open after the problem! Housing management have been also made aware.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Carlton Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road repairs, 17th October
item.description:
Yesterday I was crossing Pancras Road from St Pancras Station towards the German Gym, when my foot caught in the uneven patching and I severely turned my ankle. I attach here a photograph to show the deplorable state of the road surface and patch of resurfacing, and the uneven setts. This is clearly dangerous to pedestrians, who should be paying attention to the lights and to the traffic, as indeed I was, and not looking at the ground. Have no fear, I am not making any claims for damages or compensation, I am bringing this to your attention so that it can be dealt with before anyone hurts themselves more seriously.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pancras Road, King's Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In front of 24 Honiton Rd NW6 6QD, 17th October
item.description:
Raised slabs representing tripping hazard. Probably due to tree roots causing slabs to move up. Tree works will also be necessary to control growing tree or this will keep getting worse. Please inform relevant department to inspect tree with view to contain tree growth and check if roots go down as tree grows or if roots are shallow and spread under street surface.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
